text:
Arlington is a city in Reno County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 473 people lived there.
History.
Arlington was created in 1877. It was named after Arlington, Massachusetts. The first post office in Arlington was created in February 1878.
In 1887, the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway built a railroad from Herington through Arlington to Pratt.
Geography.
Arlington is at (37.896363, -98.179313). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 473 people, 200 households, and 124 families living in Arlington.
